resources.string: Export failed - could not write to the shared storage
If the problem persists, contact support via Help on the main menu.

Warning. Importing data may update existing book records with new information if the uuid column is not present and the id in the import file is the same as an existing id. This is usually fine if you changed a field in an exported file. If you created a new book record, or are importing another persons books, ensure the uuid field is present or the id field is blank.
ERROR: Import of data failed. Please contact support.
This option is not supported for older archive versions.

PLEASE READ THIS MESSAGE CAREFULLY 

Google has required that this and all future versions of Book Catalogue must store their files in more standard directories. 

They also no longer allow us to access the old directories. 

We have detected an upgrade from an old version of the app and need to be granted access to it in order to move the files. 

Click '%1$s' to continue and then grant access in the following dialog. If you select '%2$s' then you can always restart this process via '%3$s'->'%4$s'.
Please check that the storage is writable, and has sufficient space.
There was a problem starting the import: %1$s
Select at least one field to update
This option is not available until the book is saved
An unexpected error has occurred, please send the details to support using the \'Help\' option from the main menu
Author is already in the list
At least one author must be specified

It looks like your existing barcode scanner app is not compatible with Book Catalogue. We recommend installing the Zxing barcode scanner application, and if it is already installed, we recommend uninstalling it and reinstalling it.
The scanned book was not found. You can sometimes find the correct barcode on the inside front cover. Otherwise please enter the details manually.
You cannot edit the system values

You have changed the author from:
 '%1$s' to 
 '%2$s'
How do you wish to apply this change?
Note: The choice '%3$s' will be applied instantly.

You have changed the series from:
 '%1$s' to 
 '%2$s'
How do you wish to apply this change?
Note: The choice 'All Books' will be applied instantly.
Columns %1$s are all blank at row %2$d
It looks like BookCatalogue has crashed. If possible describe anything you think may be relevant below and press "OK" to send us an email about the crash. You will see the email before it is sent.
BookCatalogue has crashed unexpectedly. Please help us to make the application better by reporting this crash.
Please take the time to briefly describe the problem you are experiencing.
All books in the archive will be imported, updating existing books and adding new ones.
The details of the books themselves
Cover images for all selected books. Will make the export much larger.
Select what will be exported to the archive.
Optionally specify a date to use in selecting books and/or covers to export:
All books, covers, settings and custom styles will be exported to the archive.
The books in your catalogue will be exported. Select on one of two options to start the export, or press \'back\' to cancel:
The books in this archive will be imported. Select on one of two options to start the import, or press \'back\' to cancel:
Only import books that are new, or which have been updated more recently in the archive. This is useful when synchronizing two devices.
You have not created any bookshelves yet. Please add some using the add icon at the top of this screen.
This will update the selected fields as shown, but Thumbnails can optionally be downloaded for ALL books.\n\nDo you want to overwrite all existing thumbnails? Warning, this may take a long time.
Selected fields will be updated from the internet. Unselected fields will remain unchanged.
The book you are trying to add already exists in the database, are you sure you want to add another copy?
File must contain a column with one of the following names: %s
If shown for every author, a single book may appear more than once in a list. In such a case deleting one of those books will delete all instances from the list.
If you find yourself always rotating camera images in the same direction, try changing the application settings to specify a rotation to apply automatically.
From here you can see the events associated with a background task. Clicking on a event will allow you to perform a variety of actions appropriate for that event.

From here you can see the currently running tasks as well as previous tasks that have completed with errors or other notable events. Clicking on a task will allow you to see the events associated with that task as well as delete the task (and related events).
Tapping on a book will show you book details, a long-press on an item in the list give you further options.

You can use this screen to set the default characteristics of all library styles. 

Most properties can be overridden by individual styles, but the default values are defined here. 

You can change the background, change how lists are displayed at startup, and adjust a variety of other settings that will be applied to all your styles when possible. 

You can also edit the styles menu, and the styles themselves from here.

You can use this screen to modify the hierarchy of headings for a specific library style. 

A green tick indicates the heading will be shown in the list, and a red cross indicates it will not be shown. Clicking on a green tick will turn it into a cross, and vice-versa. 

You can re-order the hierarchy by dragging the icon at the extreme right of each row up or down.
This menu allows you to select the style of the list. \n\nYou can also customize this menu, as well as create your own list styles, by clicking \'Customize\' at the end of the list.

You can use this screen to set the characteristics of a specific library style. 

You can change the name, edit the groupings to change the hierarchy, and adjust a variety of other settings to build a style that you find useful. 

It is also possible to use 'Book Filters' to modify the selection of books that will be displayed in the list. eg. to only retrieve books you have not read yet.

You can use this screen to customize the list of styles that will be displayed in your default styles menu. 

A green tick indicates the style will be shown in the list, and a red cross indicates it will not be shown. Clicking on a green tick will turn it into a cross, and vice-versa. 

If no styles are ticked, then all styles will be shown. 

It is also possible to re-order the items by dragging the icon at the extreme right of each row. 

Clicking anywhere else in a row will allow you to edit the details of a specific style (or clone it, if it is a built-in style).
If shown in every series, a single book may appear more than once in a list. In such a case deleting one of those books will delete all instances from the list.
This is the standard BookCatalogue startup screen. If you prefer, you can startup directly in \'My Books\'; the preferred startup screen can be changed in Settings.

The lead developer of Book Catalogue has developed a new app!

Keep track of locations, images, recordings and notes; and if you are into science, then manage samples and labels.

Please check it out in the Play Store:

Tempus Locum

or you can see the web site here:

http://www.tempuslocum.com/
When you click on an item in this list, you can now choose to go to non-editable book details view. See "Other Preferences" for the relevant setting.
This is the non-editable book details screen; you can fling/swipe left or right to navigate to other books, and you can edit the book via the options menu using the menu button or overflow menu icon.
If day is specified, then both month and year must also be specified.
If month is specified, then year must also be specified.
The file is not a valid backup
Would you like to send this export as an email somewhere?
Do you agree to allow public details from your book records (like ISBNs and Titles) to be used to improve search results for everyone.
This book has been loaned to:
All stories in this anthology are written by the same author
Find a book in your catalogue

New in 4.2 * Date-Picker that supports dates down to 0AD as well as partial dates * HTML descriptions display correctly with click to edit * Preference for pre-selecting whole image when cropping * Preference for auto-rotating images from camera * Preference to use external cropping tool (experimental) * Added more items to the options menus * French translation updates (Imkal) * German translation updates (Robert Wetzlmayr) * Russian translation updates (Nick Silin) * Updated OK/Cancel button positions to conform to current Android standards * Full keyboard available when entering ASINs * Keeps 5 previous export files * Better detection of 'changes' when editing books * Support for a wider range of Gallery and file browsers * More reliable date handling on import/export/sync * Fix handling of duplicate anthology titles * Various bugs fixed Many thanks to our dedicated beta testers and translators! Blame Grunthos for all bugs and errors. And send us bug reports.
New in 4.2.1\n\n * Fix crash when expanding list items and using \'Expand All\'\n\n

New in 4.2.2 * Fix tiling of background image for some Android versions * Better handling of incompatible scanner apps * Send more details on crash or when asking for help * Cleanup of layouts (Nick Silin) * Bug fixes
New in 4.2.3 * Improve handling of invalid ISBNs when sending to goodreads * Other minor bug fixes

New in 4.2.4 * A non-editable view of book details, with 'fling' support! (See "Other Preferences") (Nick Silin) * Support for pic2shop scanner (better for fixed focus, low light and in front-facing cameras) * Check internet connection earlier when trying to scan books * More German translation updates (Robert Wetzlmayr) * More French translation updates (Djiko) * Bug fixes

New in 5.0.0 * A non-editable view of book details, with 'fling' support! (See "Other Preferences") (Nick Silin) * Archiving (Backup & Import) of entire catalogue, including books, covers, preferences and styles * Updated interface with Action Bar support for usability and to work better on devices without menu buttons * Support for pic2shop scanner (better for fixed focus, low light and in front-facing cameras) * goodreads now appears in main menu if you authorize it * Check internet connection earlier when trying to scan books * More German translation updates (Robert Wetzlmayr) * More French translation updates (Imkal & Djiko) * More Russian translation updates (Nick Silin) * Internal changes in anticipation of an improved tablet interface * Bug fixes
New in 5.0.3 * Bug fixes * French translation updates (Imkal)
New in 5.0.4 * New field: Language * French translation updates (Imkal) * Bug fixes
New in 5.0.5 * "Added Date" List now sorted in reverse order * French translation updates (Imkal) * Bug fixes
New in 5.0.9\n\n * Bug fix for Android 4.4 (KitKat)\n\n * Dutch translation (Gideon van Melle)\n\n * Other minor bug fixes

New in 5.1.0 * Italian translation (Eugenio Davolio) * Spanish translation (José M. Galdo) * Turkish translations (Emir Sarı) * Ability to archive only new/updated books and to exclude covers (or books) * Better thumbnail size in lists for high density screens * Added options to see books by author/series at Amazon * Other minor bug fixes
New in 5.1.1 * Bug fixes * New style: Group by last update date * New style: Group by rating * New style: Group by bookshelf name
New in 5.2.0 * User-selectable locale in Preferences * Greek translation (Dimitris Klisiaris) * Locale-specific capitalization (de, fr) * Improvements to search * Bug fixes
New in 5.2.3 * Add a 'Home' button to the Backup/Import dialogues * Build compatible with Android 9 * Bug fixes
New in 5.3.0 * Uses new Book-Catalogue web services for searching * Bug fixes

New in 6.0.0\n\n

  • Builtin scanner! We now use native machine Android library to read barcodes. Old scanners are still available in case there are issues, but will be removed in a future release.
  • Complete reorganization of files. Google does not like us writing files to the location we were using. Covers now go in private app folders and we use the \'standard\' interface for importing or exporting to backups and CSV files.
  • goodreads support is no more. They disabled their API a while ago and it has not come back.
  • LibraryThing support is no more. They disabled their API a while ago and it has not come back.
  • Many bug fixes

New in 7.0.0\n\n

  • Completely new and modern interface based on Android material design.
  • Improvements to ISBN search to replace sources (such as Amazon) that are no longer available.
  • Discontinued support for Android Nougat (2016) and earlier.
  • Many bug fixes.
  • The next upgrade will contain enable the most requested feature - online backup and sync.
%1$d of %2$d files were processed. %3$s\n\nThe old files have been left in place and can be moved or deleted once you have verified that the app is running correctly.
%1$d were not copied because they were duplicates
%1$d were not copied because they were cover image files for non-existent books
All books added or updated since last full backup
Cache resized thumbnails (uses more storage, lists will scroll faster)
Generate immediately (lists scroll slower, images will be displayed immediately)
Resize each time they are needed (uses less storage, scrolling will be slower)
Show first level heading and number of books
Use background thread (lists scroll faster, images may be delayed)
A %3$s file called %2$s was created in the %1$s directory. \n\nYou should manually copy it elsewhere to protect the data in case your device is damaged, lost, or stolen.
You are logged in and your data is being backed up as:
Log in with your Google account to automatically back up your book catalogue. This will keep your data safe and allow you to restore it on any device.

Purgeable files currently use %s of storage. Log files and other data are saved at each upgrade, when you backup the database, or when the application crashes. Click the button below to purge these files from your storage. If you have been experiencing crashing or other errors, please consider using the \'Send Information\' button first.
"The ability to backup and sync your book catalogue online is coming very soon. "
If you would like to support the development of this application, please donate using a my Amazon Wishlist or the paypal button below. Being in Australia means I cannot publish a paid version. :-)

Would you like to help other Book Catalogue users? 

By clicking 'Yes', you agree to allow public details from your book records (like ISBNs and Titles) to be used to improve search results for everyone.

Private notes and personal details remain secure.

You can change this at any time in the Settings.
Please click here to access the online help pages
NOTE: All saved changes apply instantly and globally
Adding books by ISBN is much more accurate than adding by author and title and is generally preferred. Please remember you can sometimes find the correct barcode on the inside front cover. \n\n
Selected fields are visible in the add/edit book screens. Unselected fields are hidden.
There are no authors for this Book. Please add some using the text area and button at the top of this screen.
There are no books in this Bookshelf. Please add some using the menu at the bottom of this screen.
There are no series for this Book. You can add some using the text area and button at the top of this screen.
The selected archive is %1$s in size and was created on %2$s.

Click on the button below to gather information about any recent crashes or other errors and send it to one of our developers. This will create a backup copy of your entire database as well as any log files. If you do not wish to send any of these files, delete it from the mail attachments before sending.

BookCatalogue is the product of the efforts of many people, and would not have such wide use without the generous help of our volunteer translators: %1$s (if we have forgotten someone, please tell us).\n
This is required to photograph new book covers and to scan barcodes.
This is required to find details of books and grant access to services such as goodreads and LibraryThing.
In order to continue, Book Catalogue needs access to the following privileges:\n\n
This is required to check if network is available when internet access is required (eg. when a search is requested).
This is required to import images captured by the camera, to restore backups and exports, to read cover thumbnails and to read information for debugging and recovery.
This is required to save images captured by the camera, to restore backups and exports, to create cover thumbnails and to save information for debugging and recovery.
Please check that the storage is accessible.
Automatically rotate images captured by camera
Beep if scanned ISBN is invalid
Beep if scanned ISBN is valid
Default crop frame is whole image
This will completely delete the book entitled \'%1$s\' by %2$s. Are you sure you wish to proceed?

Really delete series '%s'?

The books themselves will not be deleted.

Consider editing the series and changing the series name to that of another series to preserve this data
Searching for the book failed. Please check your network settings.
The selected directory is not called \'%1$s\' and does not seem to contain a directory of that name. Are you sure that this is the correct location?
Series is already in the list
